title: PewDiePie and Marzia Kjellberg's Japanese getaway photos after wedding
text:
We’re getting major travel envy (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

After their wedding, PewDiePie and Marzia Kjellberg have clearly been in need of some time off, as they jetted off to Japan for a romantic getaway.

With the couple posting gorgeous snaps of the scenery as well as the pair of them clearly having a blast, we’re all getting incredibly jealous of the trip of a lifetime.

All apart from Marzia’s gruesome injury, that is…

They kicked off the trip by visiting an art gallery and making sure to visit the amazing roof terrace.

They’ve been making the most of the Japanese food (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

With Marzia snapping the nighttime views of Tokyo, including the skyscrapers and markets, it’s clear why they love it so much.

Felix went on to show off his silly side as he danced with a Japanese street performer, before the pair watched a stunning fireworks display.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Had a memorable day in Tokyo,’ the 29-year-old wrote on his Instagram Stories. ‘We love it here, the city is amazing and fun to share with friends.’

It’s clearly a romantic spot for Felix and Marzia as they got engaged during their trip to Japan back in 2018.

The duo both posted the same photo on their social media sites to announce the happy news.

Marzia’s been quick to share gorgeous snaps (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

While Marzia announced it with a simple: ‘Felix proposed!’, her hubby-to-be went with slightly more unsure: ‘She said she’d think about it.’

Luckily, it seems Marzia was a little more sure than her beau made out, with the pair tying the knot at an intimate ceremony in London’s Kew Gardens.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

In his emotional speech, the YouTube star was heard telling his new wife: ‘I am most of all happy and grateful to finally be Marzia’s husband. We met at a time where I was feeling very lost, but every day since I met Marzia has been the best days of my life.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Marzia has taught me to always go for what you want, without any hesitation, and that has opened my life to so many new experiences that I never would have even dreamed to be possible.

Tearing up, he added: ‘But most importantly, Marzia brings out the best in me and I feel so fortunate to be spending the rest of my life with this amazing woman.’

Check out more snaps of the pair’s envy-inducing holiday below:

They know their angles (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

Can’t escape photo-bombers – even on the other side of the world (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

The pair have been enjoying a break after their wedding (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

It looks like the trip of a lifetime (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

Felix is clearly having a blast (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

Pewds is fulfilling his Instagram husband duties (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

The pair got engaged in Japan in 2018 (Picture: @itsmarziapia)

They’ve also been enjoying the natural beauty (Picture: @itsmarziapie)

description: PewDiePie and Marzia Kjellberg's Japan holiday photos after Marzia's gruesome injury and Felix hitting 100 million.
